repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: The Nālaṭiyār, text & commentary, complete, 1 satellite stanza, no Kaṭavuḷ Vāḻttu, marginal chapter intertitles.
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (July 2020).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

collation.desc: 1 folio = Title Page (additional). No foliation. Verso blank. 400 x 30 mm.
179 folios = Nālaṭiyār: Text & Commentary. Tamil foliation {1}, 2-31, 33-179. f7v, f179v blank. 400 x 35 mm.

supportDesc.condition: Good condition with a few wormholes and some broken margins.

handNote.desc: Hand #2. Traditional script with modern ṟa.

additions.desc: BnF shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 59 (front cover, recto).
BnF bequest sticker DON N° (front cover, recto).

binding.p: Wood covers possibly fabricated in the BnF, but not of the usual type with Ariel manuscripts.

origin.origDate: No internal date found. Dated to circa 1702 (?) by Vinson (1868), on the basis of an internal date, and to 1702 by Cabaton (1912). Not after 1854, since part of the collection of Édouard Ariel (1818-1854).

provenance.p: Owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequested by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 13, no. 59.
Rosny, Léon de. 1868. La bibliothèque tamoule de M. Ariel, de Pondichéry. In Variétés orientales, 177‒224. Paris: Maisonneuve.

Vinson, Julien. 1868. Manuscrits tamouls. Proofreadings of the catalogue for Tamoul 1-204 (old shelfmark). Printed by the atelier oriental de l’Imprimerie nationale. BnF “4-IMPROR-77 (B)”. — See p. 19, no. 59. — The same proofreadings with black ink handwritten corrections are found in Vinson et al. (1866-, f1-f49).

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.

revisionDesc.change: Updated to TST encoding conventions by Emmanuel FRANCIS. Added identifiers, bibliography, history.
